required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interplay of Self-Criticism and Symptom Severity Over the Course of In-patient Psychotherapeutic Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Interplay Between Self-critisim and Symptom Severity Over the Course of In-patient Psychotherapeutic Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the interplay between self-criticism and symptom severity in patients undergoing psychotherapeutic treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants are recruited at the University Clinic Heidelberg at the beginning of their (usually) 8-week in-patient treatment, consisting of somatic and psychotherapeutic aspects. After informed consent, patients routinely fill out weekly questionnaires about their self-criticism and their symptom severity. The overall aim of this study is to disentangle stable (between-person) effects of both self-criticism and symptom severity from within-person effects happening over time in order to better understand what drives what, or in other words, their dynamic interplay. The analysis is based on the weekly assessment of the patients. All patients receive the standard care of the in-patient treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly Assessments over the course of the in-patient treatment (usually about 8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Symptom Check-List German Short Version with 11 Items

primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly Assessments over the course of the in-patient treatment (usually about 8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Theoretical Depressive Experiences Questionnaire German Short Version with 12 Items: Subscale Self-Criticism

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of patients undergoing in-patient treatment at the university clinic Heidelberg. The psychosomatic clinic treats patients over the course of (usually) 8 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing in-patient treatment at the University Clinic Heidelberg (Klinik f√ºr Allgemeine Innere Medizin und Psychosomatik)
Exclusion Criteria:
